intro: Acronia rectipetala, commonly known as the narrow-leaved acronia, is a species of flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, upright growth habit. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its leaves are narrow and pinnately divided, giving it a delicate appearance. Acronia rectipetala is often found in rocky or dry habitats, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
